item.title: About
item.description: This is a personal and professional webpage. (I am a personal and a professional person.) I teach American literature at Vilnius University. I try to improve my classes, my research, and my personal brand, as I can. I recently finished a dissertation on literatureâ€™s intersection with geographic knowledge-production in nineteenth-century America. It features chapters on Charles Brockden Brown, Margaret Fuller, and Emily Dickinson. I take photographs. I sometimes post here.

item.title: CV
item.description: Last modified: May 2023 Download PDF Professional Appointments 2020–present - Assistant Professor, Faculty of Philology, Vilnius University 2019–2020 - Junior Assistant, Faculty of Philology, Vilnius University 2016–2018 - Teaching Fellow, Department of English, University of California, Los Angeles Education 2020 - PhD, English, University of California, Los Angeles Dissertation: “Literature and the Production of Geography in Nineteenth-Century America” Committee: Christopher J. Looby (chair); John Agnew; Michael C. Cohen; Sarah Tindal Kareem 2014 - MA, English, University of California, Los Angeles 2010 - BA with High Distinction, English, University of Virginia Awards, Fellowships & Honors 2017 - Emily Dickinson International Society Critical Institute Keynote Award (EDIS) 2017–2018 - UCLA English Department Dissertation Year Fellowship 2016 - Departmental Conference Travel Award (UCLA) 2014–2015 - Mellon Foundation Graduate Pedagogy Working Group and Fellowship (UCLA) 2014 - Departmental Summer Research Grant (UCLA) 2013 - Fred and Edith Herman Memorial Poetry Prize, Academy of American Poets 2012 - Graduate Summer Research Mentorship with Christopher Looby (UCLA) 2011 - UCLA University Fellowship Publications Book Chapters “Dickinson’s Geographic Poetics,” in The New Emily Dickinson Studies, ed.

item.title: localauthor
item.description: Occasional short sketches on local fare and otherwise, offered freely.

item.title: poem-machine
item.description: Turning your favorite source text into the stock of your creations one random word at a time. Command-line version: https://github.com/localauthor/poem-machine

item.title: poem-machine-crawl
item.description: Wonder at the infinite crawl of the poem-machine. Currently Serving Up: Dickinson’s Poems (1890) Thoreau’s Journal Fuller’s Summer on the Lakes (1844) Some reports from the machine: https://localauthor.github.io/poem-machine-poems Or, visit the Github repository, to see the source code: https://github.com/localauthor/poem-machine-crawl

item.title: zk
item.description: An Emacs package for taking notes using the Zettelkasten method. Introduction and Key Features Demo of setup and basic features Demo of ‘Index’ and ‘Desktop’ interfaces
